questions.questionPhrase: Please inform the customer we request they answer a series of questions to better understand the issue.
Document the reported issue and how the issue occurred according to the customer.
Was property external to the Apple computer, accessory, or device damaged?
Document the damage using the customer's own words.
Was there discomfort or injury?
Document the discomfort or injury using the customer's own words
Who is the affected party?
Is the affected party a Minor?
Is the affected party reporting the issue?
Was medical attention required?
Document medical attention required using the customer's own words
What is the customer's relationship to the affected party?
Was medical attention required?
Document medical attention required using the customer's own words
Is the affected party reporting the issue?
Was medical attention required?
Document medical attention required using the customer's own words
What is the customer's relationship to the affected party?
Was medical attention required?
Document medical attention required using the customer's own words
Read but do not ask the customer; Based on the questions asked, documentation reviewed, and any consultation paths available, do you believe this is a potential safety issue?
Please inform the customer that to fully investigate their report there are a series of additional questions we are required to ask. These questions may require some time to ask and answer.

Where did the issue occur?
Please document the City, State/Province, Setting (home, hotel, etc.), and physical location (desk, table, bed, etc.) the issue occurred.
Was the issue related to Heat?
Is anything on the device melted or discolored?

Is the damage to the device or an accessory?
(cable, power adapter, etc.)
Describe what is melted.
Did the device show the thermal alert?
Describe what is melted.
Were Flames present?
Where were the flames coming from? (Headphone port, 30 pin/lightning connector, sides, cable, power adapter, etc.)

Were the flames the result of improper use or accidental damage?
(Disassembly, Tampering, willful destruction, acts of God)
How did the accidental damage/improper use occur?
Did the flames have to be extinguished, or did they die out on their own?
Was Smoke present?
Where was smoke emanating from and what color was the smoke?
Was the issue related to Electric Shock?
Is there a case on the device?
What is the make and model of the case?
Was the shock continuous or brief?

Does the shock stop when the customer disconnects the USB cable?
(not connected to the power adapter)

What part of the device shocked the customer?
(case, cable, power adapter,glass, etc.)
Is the issue related to broken glass?
How did the glass break?
Did the customer knowingly continue to use the device with broken glass?
How did the customer receive the cut?
Was the issue related to fluid leaking from the device?
What color is the fluid?
How much fluid is leaking from the device?
Is the issue related to sparks?
Where were the sparks coming from?
Are there any additional issues or concerns to report?
Please describe the additional issues or concerns.
Please gather and include in your escalation any relevant additional documentation, pictures, fire department reports, medical reports, etc., and escalate this potential safety issue.

You have selected "No" indicating this is not a safety issue. Please document your reason for selecting "No" in your notes, save your case, and then re-classify your case as a hardware issue.
